title: No AP junglers above 50% winrate
body:
Not a QQ, just something I noticed. And by AP junglers, I mean the junglers who most frequently use Runeglaive as their JG enchant, 
so pls no hate from all of you who play AP Malph / Sej / Amumu / Zac / whatever tank you decide to build full ap on.

Source: [Champion.gg](http://champion.gg/statistics/#?roleSort=Jungle&sortBy=general.winPercent&order=descend)

Also, I'm not sure if Gameplay is the right place for this, so I'm gonna put it in Misc.

EDIT: SO, I posted this to reddit and got front page. Fun stuff.

replies.body:
Strangely enough,

I see atleast 3 (4 perhaps. We have different play-styles)

Shaco (I enjoy AP Jungling. It's fun.), Amumu, Nunu, Zac.
Yes, but that's why I said ones that most frequently build Runeglaive. While people do build those champs full ap, most of the time it's CInderhulk, or in the case of Shaco, warrior.

Does that website you posted only count them when played in the jungle because when I look at lolking it says diana has only dipped below 50% winrate for a single day in the past 40 days and that was a winrate of 49.90%. Not even dropping below 50% when she was free to play in normals which is usually a time win rates drop a good amount and in ranked in basicly all the ranked elos she consistently has over a 50% winrate. Lolking counts the winrate of all lanes though. Also, your looking at plat+ which Is a very small percentage of the game's population so I don't think your statics are 100% accurate to the current situation. 10.55 percent of the entire ranked population exist in Plat or higher to be exact.

Edit: Added more detail. Edited multiple times.

There are seperate win rates for each role.

I believe that only showing plat+ is more accurate than showing from all elos, because it shows the true strength of a champ. Some things are just more powerful at low elos, not because they are actually strong, but because the players don't know how to deal with it.

BUT, even if i'm wrong, GLOBALLY, not even only plat+ but all elos, there are no runeglaive jgs with a winrate higher than 50%

and, diana jungle has a winrate below 50% since 5.21

sources: 
[Diana Win Rate 1](http://champion.gg/champion/Diana/Jungle)
[Diana Win Rate 2](http://www.leagueofgraphs.com/champions/stats/diana/jungle/all)
[Global Jungle Win Rates](http://www.leagueofgraphs.com/champions/stats/jungle/all/by-winrate)
Holy shit this website goes into extreme detail. I love it. Thanks for showing me.

How you build a champion is your choice, just because you throw up full tank builds doesn't mean they aren't AP champs. You're building largely the same items on every one of these champs, and those are some pretty shit builds. Zac and Sej have gapclosers and dont need the added MS that DMP gives, double banshees veil on amumu, and ninja tabbi on them all, ninja tabbi+thornmail is a very situational set of items. Poorly thought out post is poorly thought out.

> [{quoted}](name=sixdogman,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=htoavjQ7,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2015-12-04T22:12:18.965+0000)
>
> Poorly thought out post is poorly thought out.

I've responded with greater thought than your posts have shown.

If you site the win rates for a champion, then you must also assume the builds that are being actually built on those champions. Saying "they *could* be building AP" is the same as saying that LeBlanc *could* be building AD. She isn't, and neither are these tanks. 

Those builds are directly from champion.gg, either the most popular build or the highest win rate build, depending on which one gives more AP. They're more representative of what those champions are actually building than claiming some of them are building Runeglaive.

take those builds with a grain of salt because they recommend things like double banshees veil amumu. Saying they _could_ be building tank is the same as saying they _could_ be building AP. Builds are a choice. As is how much AP constitutes an AP champ. You are employing either the no true scottsman fallacy or moving the goalposts here depending on how you try to argue your next point. 

Hint: that winrate probably means someone did it once for lols when they were really ahead and won while no one else has built that because duh.

Actually, it says how many people ran the build (the builds are out of all the games that got to 6 completed items). That specific Amumu build has been run 372 times this patch.

The point the OP was making was all about Runeglaive being picked up. Champions who's primary build path isn't tank, but actual AP mage. I personally love AP Ezreal, but I wouldn't argue that Ezreal's winrate on any site is representative of his AP build.

i just want fiddle to get a jungle item that's worth building on him :c
that and a rework so riot will let him
Really should use League of graphs
League of graphs is a good tool, it also supports the same data

It's worth pointing out that according to League of Graphs, Runeglaive is used on only 10% of junglers.

All the jungle enchantments combined totaled a 20.2% popularity (sanity check says that's about 1/5th, which matches the number of junglers per team)

Warrior is the most common, being picked by 39.6% of junglers.
Cinderhulk is the second most common, being picked by 26.2% of junglers
Devourer comes in third with 23.8%
Runeglaive is dead last, being picked up by 10.4% of junglers

Cinderhulk and Devourer's pick rates seem about right, we'd assume that the enchantments would be picked an even amount of times. Which means that Warrior and Runeglaive (or the junglers that would pick those) are out of balance.
